Seita Emori (a mụrụ ya n'afọ 1970 na Kanagawa, Japan) bụ onye sayensị gburugburu ebe obibi nke mba Japan nke ọrụ ya a ma ama na-elekwasị anya na mmetụta ụwa nke Global Warming. Ọ gụsịrị nzere Doctorate ya na Mahadum Tokyo n'afọ 1997 ma mesịa sonye na National Institute for Environmental Studies, ebe ọ bụ ugbu a Chief of the Climate Risk Assessment Research Section na Center for Global Environmental Research. Emori bụ onye edemede na-enye aka na Fourth, Fifth na Sixth Assessment Reports of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) na onye otu IPCC Steering Committee maka "Expert Meeting on New Scenarios", nke IPCC natara Nobel Prize n'afọ 2007.

N'etiti akwụkwọ Emori bụ akwụkwọ agụmakwụkwọ "Sensitivity Map of LAI to Precipitation and Surface Air Temperature Variations in a Global Scale" (nke ya na ndị ọrụ ibe ya bụ Hiroshi Kanzawa na Jiahua Zhang na Congbin Fu nke START, Institute of Atmospheric Physics na Beijing, China dere).
